faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions and answers about Base64 PDF conversion

whatIsBase64.question: What is Base64 encoding?
whatIsBase64.answer: Base64 is an encoding method that represents binary data using 64 printable characters. It's commonly used to transmit binary data like PDF files in text protocols.

whyUseBase64.question: Why convert PDF to Base64?
whyUseBase64.answer: Base64 encoded PDFs can be directly embedded in text formats like HTML, CSS, JSON, making them convenient for web applications while avoiding binary data transmission compatibility issues.

fileSizeLimit.question: What is the file size limit?
fileSizeLimit.answer: Currently supports PDF files up to 50MB. For larger files, consider compressing the PDF or splitting into multiple smaller files for processing.

securityConcerns.question: Is the conversion process secure?
securityConcerns.answer: Yes, all conversions are completed in your browser, files are not uploaded to servers, ensuring your documents are completely private and secure.

browserCompatibility.question: Which browsers support this tool?
browserCompatibility.answer: Supports all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc. Recommend using the latest browser versions for the best experience.

base64Size.question: Does Base64 encoding increase file size?
base64Size.answer: Yes, Base64 encoding typically increases file size by about 33%. This is normal for the encoding process, and the original size is restored after decoding.

qualityLoss.question: Is there quality loss during conversion?
qualityLoss.answer: No. Base64 is lossless encoding, the conversion process doesn't change PDF content or quality, the decoded file is identical to the original.

batchProcessing.question: Does it support batch processing?
batchProcessing.answer: Currently supports single file processing. For batch needs, you can use the tool multiple times, or consider using our API service.
